p: The biological activities of agar oligosaccharides include anti-microbial, antiviral [ 78], prebiotic [ 79], anti-tumoral, immunomodulatory, anti-inflammatory [ 76, 80, 81, 82, 83, 84, 85, 86, 87], glucosidase inhibitory [ 77], anticariogenic [ 34], hepatoprotective [ 83], antioxidant [ 77, 83] and other properties of interest for skin care [ 45, 77, 84, 85] ( Figure 2). Liu et al. [ 86] summarized research progress on biological activities of agaro-oligosaccharide. Agaro-oligosaccharides display antioxidant effects which differ according to their degree of polymerization [ 77]; additionally, Kaz≈Çowski et al. [ 87] summarized the influence of the degree of polymerization (DP) of agar oligomers on their physiological activities. Agarose is biocompatible and has been used for neural and cartilage tissue repair [ 88] and for the preparation of biomaterials [ 89, 90]. Due to its low cell adhesiveness and slow degradation rate, agarose was composited with fast degradable biomaterials for drug delivery, tissue engineering and wound healing [ 91].
